posts.cooked: I’m pretty new to programming and I need to program pneumatics for my team’s robot. I have looked at a lot of sites and I am still very confused. Could someone please help?

posts.name: Leo
posts.cooked:
WPILib has a pretty in-depth guide on how to code pneumatics:

Using the FRC Control System to control Pneumatics: There are two options for operating solenoids to control pneumatic cylinders, the CTRE Pneumatics Control Module and the REV Robotics Pneumatics ...

link_counts.title: Operating pneumatic cylinders — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: do you know of any other resources?

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked:
Is there something you’re trying to do that’s not covered by those docs? Or do you simply not understand them? Or…

We need more information to be able to help you
I simply just don’t understand it.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked:
Okay no worries at all.  Do you have the pneumatics plumbed and wired already? Or does that still need to be done?  In either case, the programming for them is fairly simple.

Pneumatics are controlled by solenoid valves.  A solenoid valve is effectively an electronically controlled switch, but instead of controlling the flow of electricity, it controls the flow of air.

As a switch, it has discrete states to toggle between.  You can use single valves (Solenoid class) or double valves (DoubleSolenoid class).  The main difference is in how they function internally, but will affect how its wired as well.  Can you share the model of solenoid valves you’re using?
Yes, the pneumatics are already plumbed and wired. Your explanation was helpful thank you!
